executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on healthcare, small caps, and AI beneficiaries in 2026. He believes the market is underestimating the potential for economic growth due to combined fiscal and monetary stimulus. He is rotating out of crowded AI cost centers (hyperscalers) and into AI beneficiaries, dividend payers, and undervalued sectors like healthcare. He sees a generational buying opportunity in healthcare and expects small caps to outperform large caps. He is also positive on housing and energy. He is buying PayPal aggressively.

key_reasons: Fiscal and monetary policy guns blazing going into 2026
Strong consumer spending and household balance sheets

macro_thesis_summary: The market is poised for strong growth in 2026, driven by fiscal stimulus, monetary easing, and rising wages. Main Street will benefit from these policies, and sectors like healthcare and small caps will outperform. The consumer is resilient, and household balance sheets are strong. The Fed's QE light and global central bank cuts will add tremendous liquidity to the market.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: Household Cash as % of Total Financial Assets
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: As rates come down, money market yields compress, forcing money into the stock market, benefiting dividend payers.
Lower rates help small caps refinance, leading to outperformance. Triple the earnings growth for slightly less multiple is a formula for success.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: Healthcare Outperformance in Midterm Election Years
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Healthcare tends to do well in volatile periods and is a major AI beneficiary.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: US Midcaps Trading at a PE
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Lowest rate we've seen since 1999 and 2000. International stocks outperform US peers. It will persist in 2026.

PYPL.thesis_summary: PayPal is undervalued due to the market underestimating its potential in agentic AI and its strong free cash flow. The company's partnerships with Google and its integration into ChatGPT will drive growth. PayPal is buying back 10% of its stock every year, increasing shareholder value.
key_metrics: 200 countries, 430 million active customers, 35 million merchants
PYPL.action: Continue to buy shares like crazy

PFE.thesis_summary: Fizer is a generational buying opportunity due to its dislocated valuation and strong free cash flow. The market is overlooking the company's cost-saving program, recent acquisitions, and long-term growth potential. The company offers a nearly 7% dividend yield and has a strong balance sheet.
key_metrics: 10 billion annual free cash flow generation
PFE.action: Building a nice size position on weakness

risks_and_contrarian_flags: Potential for increased volatility in midterm election years
Risk of being in crowded AI cost center stocks
Market underestimating the potential for economic growth
technical_takeaways: Bull bear indicator stretched, little bit of exuberance. If you're in the crowded stocks, I'd watch out after the first of the year.
